title: Continuous testing combined with Dev Services gets "wonky" after a bit of time
body:
### Describe the bug

When using continuous testing combined with dev services (in my case a PostgreSQL database, but I've seen it with other dev services too) it gets "wonky" after a bit and tests start to fail with different errors.

Stopping dev mode and re-running `./mvnw quarkus:dev` and then re-enabling continuous testing or running `./mvnw verify` will then have all tests run successfully.

### Expected behavior

I would expect that as I'm updating my tests and/or my code that continuous testing will successfully run my tests.

### Actual behavior

My tests do not run and I get exceptions when trying to communicate with the dev services (in this case a postgres db).

### How to Reproduce?

Use https://github.com/quarkus-for-spring-developers/examples/tree/main/chapter-4/chapter-4-quarkus-panache-reactive-repository as a reproducer project.

1. Clone it
2. Run `./mvnw clean quarkus:dev`
3. Press `r` to enable continuous testing. All tests should pass
4. Open `src/test/java/org/acme/rest/FruitResourceTests.java`
5. In the `getAll` method, simple add a newline between `Mockito.when...` and `given()...`
6. Save `FruitResourceTests`. This will trigger re-running of the tests in this class.
7. Continuous testing will fail with something like
   ```shell
   : java.lang.AssertionError: 1 expectation failed.
   Expected status code <200> but was <500>.

        at io.restassured.internal.ValidatableResponseImpl.statusCode(ValidatableResponseImpl.groovy)
        at org.acme.rest.FruitResourceTests.addFruit(FruitResourceTests.java:92)
   ```

8. If you open the dev UI, the full stack trace is there:
